Html: Hi, I am trying to document a single computer sql server. I'm running the SqlServerInventoryToClixml.ps1 and I am getting a file called SQL Server Inventory - 2013-08-09-14-56 which is a text file, but I am not getting any xml file in my documents folder. can anyone help?

I worked with Susan directly on this, but for anyone else experiencing this problem - this usually happens when the TCP/IP protocol is disabled for the instance (You can enable it in SQL Server Configuration Manager).

I thought I had fixed this in the 1.0.2.0 beta that's currently posted but it looks like there are some cases that I haven't been able to reproduce in my test environment.

--Kendal
I'm having the same exact issue when scanning a SQL server I can actually scan successfully. The verbose logging txt file writes to the specified directory, but I am not seeing an xml output file.

Clarencew4,
Are you scanning a named instance on your local machine?

--Kendal

Hi Kendal,
No, there is not a named instance on the SQL server I scanned. Only the default.

Clarencew4,
Let's carry this over to the other thread that you started since I'm not sure if this is the same issue that Susan was having or something else...

--Kendal
